info.title: API Reference
info.description:
# Introduction
Jan API is compatible with the [OpenAI API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference).

tags.name: Models
tags.description: List and describe the various models available in the API.

tags.name: Chat
tags.description: Given a list of messages comprising a conversation, the model will return a response.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: Messages capture a conversation's content. This can include the content from LLM responses and other metadata from [chat completions](/specs/chats).

tags.name: Assistants
tags.description: Configures and utilizes different AI assistants for varied tasks

post.description: Creates a model response for the given chat conversation. Equivalent to OpenAI's create chat completion.

get.description: Lists the currently available models, and provides basic information about each one such as the owner and availability. Equivalent to OpenAI's list model.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: The ID of the model to use for this request.

get.description: Get a model instance, providing basic information about the model such as the owner and permissioning. Equivalent to OpenAI's retrieve model.

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: The ID of the model to use for this request.

delete.description: Delete a model. Equivalent to OpenAI's delete model.

post.description: Create a thread. Equivalent to OpenAI's create thread.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all threads available in the system.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific thread using its thread_id. Equivalent to OpenAI's retrieve thread.

parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: The ID of the thread to retrieve.

patch.description: Modifies a thread. Equivalent to OpenAI's modify thread.

parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: The ID of the thread to be modified.

title.description: Set the title of the thread

delete.description: Delete a thread. Equivalent to OpenAI's delete thread.

parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: The ID of the thread to be deleted.

get.description: Return a list of assistants. Equivalent to OpenAI's list assistants.

source.example:
import requests

url = 'http://localhost:1337/v1/assistants'
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json'}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

get.description: Retrieves an assistant. Equivalent to OpenAI's retrieve assistants.

parameters.name: assistant_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assistant to retrieve.

get.description: Retrieves all messages from the given thread. Equivalent to OpenAI's list messages.

parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: The ID of the thread from which to retrieve messages.

post.description: Create a message. Equivalent to OpenAI's list messages.

parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: The ID of the thread to which the message will be posted.

role.description: Role of the sender, either 'user' or 'assistant'.

content.example: How does AI work? Explain it in simple terms.

get.description: Retrieve a specific message from a thread using its thread_id and message_id. Equivalent to OpenAI's retrieve messages.

parameters.name: thread_id
parameters.description: The ID of the thread containing the message.

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: The ID of the message to retrieve.

post.description: Describe a model offering that can be used with the API. Equivalent to OpenAI's model object.
Build assistants that can call models and use tools to perform tasks. Equivalent to OpenAI's assistants object.
Information about a message in the thread. Equivalent to OpenAI's message object.
Represents a thread that contains messages. Equivalent to OpenAI's thread object.

id.description: The identifier of the thread, defaults to foldername.

object.description: Type of the object, defaults to thread.

title.description: A brief summary or description of the thread, defaults to an empty string.

assistant_id.description: The identifier of assistant, defaults to "jan"

settings.description: Defaults to and overrides assistant.json's "settings" (and if none, then model.json "settings")

parameters.description: Defaults to and overrides assistant.json's "parameters" (and if none, then model.json "parameters")

created.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the thread, defaults to file creation time.

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the thread, defaults to an empty object.

object.description: Type of the object

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the thread.

assistants.description: List of assistants involved in the thread.

messages.description: List of messages within the thread.

id.description: The identifier of the newly created thread.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the thread.

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the newly created thread.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread.

title.description: A brief summary or description of the thread, defaults to an empty string.

assistant_id.description: The identifier of assistant, defaults to "jan"

assistant_name.description: The name of assistant, defaults to "Jan"

instructions.description: The instruction of assistant, defaults to "Be my grammar corrector"

settings.description: Defaults to and overrides assistant.json's "settings" (and if none, then model.json "settings")

parameters.description: Defaults to and overrides assistant.json's "parameters" (and if none, then model.json "parameters")

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the thread, defaults to an empty object.

file_ids.description: "Array of file IDs associated with the message, if any."

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the thread.

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the modified thread.

id.description: The identifier of the deleted thread.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating the thread has been deleted.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the thread was successfully deleted.

source_url.description: URL to the source of the model.

id.description: Unique identifier used in chat-completions model_name, matches folder name.

version.description: The version number of the model.

description.example: Trinity is an experimental model merge using the Slerp method. Recommended for daily assistance purposes.

format.description: State format of the model, distinct from the engine.

object.description: The type of the object, indicating it's a model.

created.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the model.

owned_by.description: The entity that owns the model.

source_url.description: URL to the source of the model.

id.description: Unique identifier used in chat-completions model_name, matches folder name.

version.description: The version number of the model.

description.example: Trinity is an experimental model merge using the Slerp method. Recommended for daily assistance purposes.

format.description: State format of the model, distinct from the engine.

id.description: The identifier of the model that was deleted.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a model.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the model was successfully deleted.

id.description: The identifier of the model that was started.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a model.

state.description: The current state of the model after the start operation.

id.description: The identifier of the model that was started.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a model.

state.description: The current state of the model after the start operation.

message.description: Message indicates Jan starting download corresponding model.

id.description: Sequential or UUID identifier of the message.

object.description: Type of the object, defaults to 'thread.message'.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the message.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread to which this message belongs. Defaults to parent thread.

assistant_id.description: Identifier of the assistant involved in the message. Defaults to parent thread.

role.description: Role of the sender, either 'user' or 'assistant'.

annotations.description: Annotations for the text content, if any.

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the message, defaults to an empty object.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread message.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the message.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread to which this message belongs.

role.description: Role of the sender, either 'user' or 'assistant'.

value.example: How does AI work? Explain it in simple terms.

annotations.description: Annotations for the text content, if any.

file_ids.description: Array of file IDs associated with the message, if any.

assistant_id.description: Identifier of the assistant involved in the message, if applicable.

run_id.description: Run ID associated with the message, if applicable.

id.description: The identifier of the created message.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread message.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the message.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread to which this message belongs.

role.description: Role of the sender, either 'user' or 'assistant'.

value.example: How does AI work? Explain it in simple terms.

annotations.description: Annotations for the text content, if any.

file_ids.description: Array of file IDs associated with the message, if any.

assistant_id.description: Identifier of the assistant involved in the message, if applicable.

run_id.description: Run ID associated with the message, if applicable.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a list.

first_id.description: Identifier of the first message in the list.

last_id.description: Identifier of the last message in the list.

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more messages to retrieve.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread message.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the message.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread to which this message belongs.

role.description: Role of the sender, either 'user' or 'assistant'.

value.example: How does AI work? Explain it in simple terms.

annotations.description: Annotations for the text content, if any.

file_ids.description: Array of file IDs associated with the message, if any.

assistant_id.description: Identifier of the assistant involved in the message, if applicable.

run_id.description: Run ID associated with the message, if applicable.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread message file.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the file.

message_id.description: Identifier of the message to which this file is associated.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a list.

messages.description: Contains input data or prompts for the model to process.

example.content: Can you write a long story

stream.description: Enables continuous output generation, allowing for streaming of model responses.

model.description: Specifies the model being used for inference or processing tasks.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens the model will generate in a single response.

stop.description: Defines specific tokens or phrases at which the model will stop generating further output.

frequency_penalty.description: Adjusts the likelihood of the model repeating words or phrases in its output.

presence_penalty.description: Influences the generation of new and varied concepts in the model's output.

temperature.description: Controls the randomness of the model's output.

top_p.description: Set probability threshold for more relevant outputs.

cache_prompt.description: Optimize performance in repeated or similar requests.

messages.description: Contains input data or prompts for the model to process.

model.description: Specifies the model being used for inference or processing tasks.

stream.description: Enables continuous output generation, allowing for streaming of model responses.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens the model will generate in a single response.

stop.description: Defines specific tokens or phrases at which the model will stop generating further output.

frequency_penalty.description: Adjusts the likelihood of the model repeating words or phrases in its output.

presence_penalty.description: Influences the generation of new and varied concepts in the model's output.

temperature.description: Controls the randomness of the model's output.

top_p.description: Set probability threshold for more relevant outputs.

finish_reason.description: Reason for finishing the response, if applicable

content.example: Hello user. What can I help you with?

created.description: Timestamp of when the response was created

model.description: Model used for generating the response

object.description: Type of the response object

usage.description: Information about the usage of tokens

completion_tokens.description: Number of tokens used for completion

prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens used in the prompt

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's an assistant.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the assistant.

description.description: Description of the assistant. Can be null.

avatar.description: URL of the assistant's avatar. Jan-specific property.

models.description: List of models associated with the assistant. Jan-specific property.

instructions.description: A system prompt for the assistant.

events.description: Event subscription settings for the assistant.
